ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Customizable multi-stream viewing for streamers, esports enthusiasts, and multi-angle monitoring.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Ultimate Layout Flexibility â€¢ Intuitive Drag & Drop Controls â€¢ Stream Management (add, remove, save, export/import) â€¢ Grid Management System (save and switch layouts) â€¢ Responsive Design
ðŸ“– Summary: StreamGrid is a cross-platform application built with Electron, React, and TypeScript that allows users to create custom multi-stream layouts with drag-and-drop functionality. It supports various streaming platforms like YouTube, Twitch, and local files, offering features like chat integration and grid management for different viewing scenarios.

âœ¨ lazyssh | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Simplifying SSH server management and connections through a terminal-based user interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Server Management (add, edit, delete, pin, ping) â€¢ Quick Server Navigation (fuzzy search, tagging, sorting) â€¢ Upcoming: File transfer UI â€¢ Upcoming: Port forwarding UI â€¢ Upcoming: Enhanced Key Management
ðŸ“– Summary: Lazyssh is a terminal-based SSH manager that simplifies the process of connecting to and managing servers. It reads server configurations from the `~/.ssh/config` file and provides a TUI for easy navigation, connection, and file transfer, inspired by tools like lazydocker and k9s.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ bytebot | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating computer tasks through natural language commands using a virtual desktop environment.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Natural Language Tasks â€¢ File Uploads â€¢ Live Desktop View â€¢ Complete Task Autonomy â€¢ Process Documents
ðŸ“– Summary: Bytebot is a self-hosted AI desktop agent that automates computer tasks through natural language commands. It operates within a containerized Linux desktop environment, allowing it to use any application, process documents, and complete complex workflows, mimicking a virtual employee with its own computer.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ oceanbase | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Distributed relational database for transactional, analytical, and AI workloads.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Vector Search â€¢ Transparent Scalability â€¢ Ultra-fast Performance â€¢ Cost Efficiency â€¢ Real-time Analytics
ðŸ“– Summary: OceanBase is a distributed relational database developed by Ant Group, designed for high availability and linear scalability. It supports transactional, analytical, and AI workloads, featuring vector database functionality for efficient vector search and HTAP capabilities without additional cost.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ slatedb | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing an embedded key-value store with the scalability and durability benefits of object storage.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Cloud-native embedded storage â€¢ LSM-tree architecture â€¢ Object storage backend (S3, GCS, ABS, MinIO, Tigris) â€¢ Bottomless storage capacity â€¢ High durability
ðŸ“– Summary: SlateDB is an embedded storage engine built on a log-structured merge-tree (LSM-tree) architecture. It differentiates itself by writing data to object storage (like S3, GCS, etc.) instead of local disk, providing bottomless storage, high durability, and easy replication, trading off latency and API costs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ speedtest-tracker | PHP
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitoring internet connection performance and uptime.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automated Tests â€¢ Detailed Metrics â€¢ Historical Data â€¢ Notifications
ðŸ“– Summary: Speedtest Tracker is a self-hosted application designed to monitor the performance and uptime of your internet connection. It allows users to schedule regular speed tests, capture detailed metrics like download/upload speeds and ping, and track historical data to identify trends and issues.
